refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This function is used to declare a new XPath extension function or redefine an existing function. It can be used in XPath queries and XSLT stylesheets. You should use QNames for extension functions. Note that the standard XPath functions cannot be redefined.
xpf_extension() stores the functions into the SYS_XPF_EXTENSIONS system table.
refsect1.programlisting: CREATE TABLE DB.DBA.SYS_XPF_EXTENSIONS ( XPE_NAME VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY, XPE_PNAME VARCHAR )
refsect1.para: The input parameters will be retrieved as a strings and then will be converted to the datatype of the corresponding argument of the stored procedure.

refsect2.title: fname
refsect2.para: The name of the extension function, which must be the expanded QName of the extension function

refsect2.title: procedure_name
refsect2.para: The fully qualified name of the PL procedure which acts as the extension function. The procedure in question must be granted to PUBLIC, otherwise it will not be registered and error will be signalled.

row.entry: if procedure to define as a XPATH extension function is not existing one.

entry.errorname: The <built-in XPATH|XQUERY> function "<func name>" cannot be re-defined

row.entry: if XPATH or XQUERY function to be registered is a core function.
